plugins.name: Variables Editor
plugins.description:
Take control of your variables with the updated Variables Editor plugin. Designed to simplify variable management in Figma, this version lets you edit linked variables directly, avoid complex navigation, and keep your workflow smooth and intuitive.


Key Features:

  1. Edit variables in place: Select any text linked to a variable and start editing it right there — no need to dig through nested structures or remember paths.
  2. Reference-aware updates: Seamlessly edit variables that reference others. Your changes automatically apply to the final target without breaking the original links.
  3. Multi-line inputs with line breaks: Edit values in spacious fields with full support for line breaks, giving you more flexibility than native controls.
  4. Undo changes instantly: Easily revert variable names or values to their previous state with a single click.
  5. Quick variable creation: Add new variables directly to the current collection, right next to the selected variable, without leaving the editing context.
  6. Resizable interface: Adjust the plugin window and input fields to suit your needs, whether working with simple text or complex structures.


Perfect for localization, UI text management, and advanced variable workflows, the Variables Editor plugin is here to help you focus on design, not tedious variable navigation.


How to assign a shortcut to the “Variables Editor” plugin:

  1. Go to System Preferences > Keyboard > Shortcuts.
  2. Select App Shortcuts from the left-hand menu.
  3. Click the + button to create a new shortcut.
  4. Set Application to Figma.
  5. Enter Variables Editor (exact plugin name) in the Menu Title field.
  6. Assign your desired shortcut (e.g., ⌘ + `)
  7. Click Add to confirm.


Your plugin is now accessible using ⌘ + `!
plugins.tagline: Find and edit variables directly in place, without navigating nested structures or losing focus.

98085.name: Spectacle
98085.description:
Simplify your workflow - transform designs into documentation.

Quickly generate precise specs for each selected layer, streamlining communication with developers.


Features include:

  1. selection indicators
  2. padding visuals
  3. detailed attribute lists
  4. layer analysis


We're just getting started—stay tuned for customizable settings and an in-depth guide.


We value your feedback—let us know how we can make Spectacle even better.
98085.release_notes:
Welcome to the latest release of Spectacle. This update brings you powerful enhancements to document generation, improved handling of auto layout properties, and better error management.

Key Highlights:

Improvements were made to the stacking order of elements in generated specification documents and enhances the handling of layout attributes for nodes with “Fill” and “Stretch” properties. Additionally, significant code refactoring has been done to streamline document generation, improve error handling, and ensure more reliable output.
  - Corrected Element Stacking Order: Refined the stacking order logic to ensure that layer badges, numbers, headers, and attributes are displayed in the correct sequence within the generated specification documents.
  - Improved Handling of Auto Layout Properties: Enhanced support for nodes with "Fill" and "Stretch" properties to accurately reflect these attributes in the generated documents.
  - Enhanced Error Handling: Added more robust error handling during document generation, allowing for better diagnostics and stability.
  - Modularized Code Structure: Refactored the codebase to improve maintainability and performance by splitting functionality into well-organized modules.
  - Automatic Selection Handling: Updated the selection management to automatically handle node selection changes more efficiently.

---

Bug Fixes:

Resolved an issue where the plugin did not correctly detect the initial selection upon opening.

Updated the plugin to accurately detect and display the selection count both upon initialization and whenever the selection changes.

All layers are now properly analyzed and included in the generated documentation. However, there are still issues with some attributes not being listed and empty layers being unnecessarily analyzed. These will be addressed in the next release.

---

Code Improvement:

Modularized Code Structure: The codebase has been significantly refactored to enhance maintainability and performance. Key components, such as badges, overlays, padding visuals, and text elements, have been separated into distinct modules within the `components`folder. This modular approach facilitates easier updates and better code organization.

Optimized Auto Layout Handling: The new `fitNodeToContainer` function within the `Container.ts` module ensures that nodes with "layoutGrow" and "layoutAlign" properties are correctly resized based on their parent's dimensions, providing a more accurate reflection of the design intent.

---

Enhanced Error Handling:

Layer Processing Error Management: The `generateDocumentStructure` function in `docHandler.ts` now includes try-catch blocks to handle errors during the processing of each layer. This ensures that the document generation process continues even if an issue occurs with a specific layer, with errors being logged for debugging purposes.

Improved Debugging Information: Additional logging has been introduced to capture more detailed information about the layer processing, aiding in troubleshooting and ensuring smoother operation.

---

Breaking Changes and Known Issues:

Preview Functionality: The preview feature is currently broken and does not display anything. We are aware of this issue and are actively working on a fix, which will be included in the next release.

Incomplete Attribute Listings: While all layers of a selection are now included in the documentation creation, some attributes are still not being listed, and empty layers are being analyzed. This is a known issue that will be addressed in the next update.

plugins.name: Cider Color Palette
plugins.description:
Cider Color Palette automatically generates hue/value Figma variables as you add, adjust, and remove colors from the Cider HSL sliders.

• Click or drag the saturation and neutral sliders to set the saturation of all your hues and neutrals.

* Remove any hue or value by dragging it off the slider

• Click any hue or lightness value to rename it


Please send any feedback to lawson.kight@gmail.com.

plugins.name: 智能文字填充 Smart Text Filler
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin allows you to quickly and randomly fill selected text layers with names, locations, or stock symbols, making it ideal for mockups and prototypes.


Function Description

  1. Randomly fill selected text layers with names, locations, or stock symbols.
  2. Each selected text layer receives a unique random value.
  3. Supports multiple text layers in a single operation.


Usage Instructions

  1. Select the text layers you want to fill.
  2. Choose one of the options: names, locations, or stock symbols.
  3. Click the "Fill Text" button to populate the selected text layers with random values.


Notes

  1. Make sure the selected text layers are editable.
  2. The plugin will preserve the original font and text styles.
  3. If no text layer is selected, the operation will not execute.


介绍

该插件可以快速随机地将选中的文字图层填充为人名、地名或股票符号，非常适合制作模型和原型设计。


功能说明

  1. 随机填充选中的文字图层为人名、地名或股票符号。
  2. 每个选中的文字图层都会得到唯一的随机值。
  3. 支持一次性操作多个文字图层。


使用方法

  1. 选择你想要填充的文字图层。
  2. 选择一个选项：人名、地名或股票符号。
  3. 点击“填充文字”按钮，将随机值填充到选中的文字图层中。


注意事项

  1. 请确保选中的文字图层是可编辑的。
  2. 插件会保留原有的字体和文本样式。
  3. 如果未选择文字图层，操作将不会执行。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Smart text filler for names, locations, and stock symbols.

plugins.name: Custom GPT
plugins.description:
How to use:

1. Enter your OpenAI key

2. Configure Prompt. If you need to handle text inside elements, insert $text into the prompt.

3. Specify a temperature between 0 and 1. 

4. Click "run"

5. Click on the items that contain text. GPT will replace the text in these items.


Video of how it works: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yAVok8hDAwc


If you are using the plugin to improve your UX copywriting, choose the maximum temperature. This gives more freedom for the LLM, which positively affects the results. 


It is also recommended to use the following prompt structure:

Text: $text

(Insert indentation between the text and the task.)

Task Description.
plugins.tagline: A simple editor for fast text processing using the OpenAI API.

plugins.name: Accessibility Checklist
plugins.description:
Ensure your digital products meet basic accessibility standards with ease.


This plugin provides a comprehensive list of essential accessibility guidelines that every designer should adhere to. By keeping this checklist handy, you can ensure that your UI and components are inclusive and accessible to all users, regardless of their abilities.


—


How to use:

  1. Run the plugin and view the list of accessibility items organized into four categories.
  2. Manually evaluate your UI and components against each item on the checklist.
  3. Check items that your UI and successfully meets.
  4. Click "Generate Report" to create a comprehensive list of all items, highlighting areas that need improvement.


*Use this report for self-assessment or to seek assistance from others.


With the Accessibility Checklist plugin, you can confidently design digital products that are accessible to everyone.


—


Made with ❤️ in México using Cursor AI and Claude 3.5. Feedback is appreciated —thank you!
plugins.tagline: A handy tool to ensure your UI and components meet essential accessibility standards.

plugins.name: Frame Organizer
plugins.description:
This plugin is ideal for cleaning up frames that are slightly misaligned when creating documents.


It adjusts the spacing between frames horizontally and vertically while maintaining the overall layout. You can set the horizontal and vertical margins and the amount of misalignment to ignore.


資料作成などで、並んでいるフレームがすこしだけがたがたしているのを綺麗にするのに最適なプラグインです。


全体の大まかなレイアウトは維持したまま、横方向、縦方向のフレーム間の間隔を調整します。横方向、縦方向のマージンや、無視するズレの大きさを設定可能です。
plugins.tagline: Clean Frame Alignment

plugins.name: SkyStage Formation Builder
plugins.description:
SkyStage is your all-in-one tool to design the drone light show of your dreams. With the Figma plugin, you can instantly drag and drop Figma rectangles to build drone light show formations, and upload them to SkyStage. Once they are on SkyStage, you can apply 3D lighting and motion effects, combine them with other formations from our library, and get them flown in a real live drone show!


SkyStage works with Figma, as well as Blender, and many other tools.


See how SkyStage works at https://www.skystage.com

plugins.name: motifalign
plugins.description:
Motifalign is one of the most valuable Figma plugins saving designers' time and contributing to their work's effectiveness. It contributes to the fast designing of design systems, supports consistency in all designs that are implemented, and promotes smart team collaboration.

The tool also identifies mistakes during des,igning and improves overall results based on elaborated consistent design patterns. With MotifAlign Studio, it is easy to edit and update design systems without significant effort. Select MotifAlign to bring better order, effectiveness, and success into your design process.

 

🧐 why use motifalign?

  • Consistency Control; MotifAlign quickly catches design mistakes and discrepancies making sure your pages align, with your design system for fixes.
  • Improved Collaboration; MotifAlign encourages communication between team members and stakeholders ensuring everyone follows the design guidelines. This helps maintain consistency and quality, throughout the project.
  • Enhanced Efficiency; MotifAlign simplifies the use of design systems speeding up the design process and making changes easier to implement.
  • Edit and Update: With MotifAlign Studio, you can easily edit and update the introduced design system.


🆕 What new features will be coming to Motifalign? 

⚡ A faster controller than the current version. 

🤩 An improved motifalign design studio experience!


You can use it for 7 days for free! 🥳 More information visit our web site


Don't forget to follow our social media accounts for new information about Motifalign!

plugins.name: Asana Task Creator
plugins.description:
About the Plugin

The Asana Task Creator is a plugin designed to facilitate integration between Figma and Asana, allowing designers and product teams to manage their tasks efficiently and collaboratively. With an intuitive interface, the plugin enables users to create, view, and manage tasks directly within the Figma design environment, eliminating the need to switch between platforms.


Key Features

  1. Secure Authentication: The plugin allows users to register and manage their Personal Access Token from Asana, ensuring secure access to their data.
  2. Data Loading: Automatically load projects and users from Asana, enabling you to choose where to assign your tasks.
  3. Task Creation: Create new tasks directly from Figma, assigning them to specific projects and users with just a few clicks.
  4. Quick Access: A button in the plugin interface allows you to open Asana directly in your browser, providing quick access to all your tasks and projects.


Benefits

  1. Increased Productivity: Centralize your design and task management operations in one place, saving time and effort.
  2. User-Friendly Experience: With a friendly interface, the plugin makes task management accessible to everyone, regardless of technical skill level.


Who Can Use It?

The Asana Task Creator is ideal for design teams, project managers, developers, and anyone using Figma and Asana in their workflow. The streamlined integration between these two platforms helps maintain efficiency and organization in creative projects.


Conclusion

Transform the way you work with the Asana Task Creator and take your task management to the next level. Install the plugin now and discover how the seamless integration between Figma and Asana can revolutionize your productivity and team collaboration!
plugins.tagline: Streamline your workflow by creating Asana tasks directly in Figma

plugins.name: Radix Custom Color
plugins.description:

  2. Group colors by name (i.e. red, blue)

plugins.name: Widget Builder
plugins.description:
Widget Builder is a powerful Figma plugin designed to help you quickly convert Figma components into fully customizable Flutter widgets. This tool bridges the gap between designers and developers, ensuring that your beautiful Figma designs are accurately and efficiently transformed into responsive, high-performance Flutter code.


How it works:

Install the Plugin: Add Widget Builder to your Figma account from the Figma Plugin Directory.

Select Components: Select and preview the components you want to convert from your Figma design.

Convert to Flutter: Click the "Copy Widget" button to generate the corresponding Flutter widget data that can be further modified in widget builder.
plugins.tagline: Convert figma components to flutter widgets

plugins.name: Concord
plugins.description:
About Concord

Concord, a game-changing Figma plugin that revolutionizes workflows by seamlessly bridging the gap between design and development.


Concord empowers teams with automation, efficiency, and flawless precision, transforming the way designers and developers collaborate. With Concord, you can streamline your processes, ensuring smoother handoffs and accelerated project timelines.


Features


1. HandOff


-> Component Breakdown:

Easily dissect design components into granular layers, providing detailed insights into each cosmetic property such as color, border, and radius.


-> Master Component Identification:

Identify master components and exclude them from handoff by default, with the option to include them as needed.


-> Tokens Values Integration:

Seamlessly integrate tokens from Token Studio into the handoff process, facilitating efficient communication of UI element properties.


-> Style Values Generation:

Generate style values for design elements, providing clear insights into applied styles and attributes.


-> Variable Values Generation:

Automatically generate variable values for design elements, enabling dynamic customization and adaptability.


-> Raw Value Generation:

Automatically generate raw values or parameters defining design element characteristics.


-> Update HandOff:

Update previous handoffs effortlessly by selecting and running the plugin for specific screens or elements.


-> Generate HandOff for All Artboards:

Generate handoff for all artboards on the page with just a single click, streamlining the process and saving valuable time for designers and developers.


2. Variant Generation

Empower your workflow with the capability to produce variants for designated components, ensuring thorough documentation coverage.


3. Analytics View - Coming Soon!


4. Lint Check - Coming Soon!


Experience the power of Concord as it enhances your Figma workflow, making collaboration effortless and results impeccable. Download Concord today and elevate your design and development journey to new heights.


Credit:

Designer -> Alpesh Karanpuria

Developer -> Sachin Kumar

Developer -> Omkar Sabade
plugins.tagline: Bridge The Design Gap

plugins.name: EcoSimulateur
plugins.description:
👏🏼 They tried it and loved it

  1. "Great product !" Aurélie - UX Designer
  2. "I say yes, I just tested it and I really like it. It’s convenient to have integrated it into Figma" Justine - Graphic Designer
  3. "Impressive" Paul - Project Manager
  4. "So cool! We dreamed of it, they did it!" Bettina - Product Designer
  5. "My new go-to plugin in Figma Dimbinirina - Lead Software Engineer


🌱 Figma Plugin “EcoSimulateur by Adveris”: Environmental Analysis from the Design Phase

EcoSimulateur by Adveris is a Figma plugin developed by the agency Adveris to integrate web eco-design principles from the very beginning of a digital project. It enables users to predict the EcoIndex score — the reference indicator developed by GreenIT / ecoindex.fr to measure the environmental impact of a web page — based on a wireframe or a graphic mockup created in Figma.


🔍 Plugin Objective

The goal is simple: provide an estimate of a web page’s EcoIndex (environmental footprint) before development even starts, helping to guide design decisions towards more sustainable alternatives.


🧠 How it Works

The plugin automatically analyzes the structure and graphical content of a Figma mockup, and extrapolates the future EcoIndex score of the final HTML page based on correlations drawn from past real-world web projects.

Specifically, the plugin estimates the three components of the EcoIndex:

  1. DOM Complexity: by analyzing the number and types of layers in the mockup, it estimates the complexity of the expected HTML code.
  2. Number of HTTP Requests: number to be entered by yourself (if new website: default number is GreenIT median / if existing website redesign: enter the current number)
  3. Page Weight: an estimate of the total weight (in KB) of the resources that will be generated from the mockup (based on images/videos area and average weight/px2). In "Options", you can customize weight/px2 and addvideo weight.


🛠️ A Decision-Support Tool for Designers

The plugin is preventive and educational: it helps designers spot areas in their mockup that are likely to generate a heavy or complex webpage, and therefore one with a poor environmental performance.

For example:

“Your current mockup could result in a page with an EcoIndex score of E. By simplifying some components and reducing resource usage, you could aim for a C or better.”

This immediate feedback allows adjustments early in the design process, instead of making costly corrections after development.


✅ Key Benefits

  1. Anticipation: predict a site’s environmental impact before it’s even coded.
  2. Design Optimization: steer design choices towards more lightweight and efficient solutions.
  3. Seamless Integration: the plugin is directly usable within Figma without disrupting the workflow.
  4. Team Education: raise awareness among designers about eco-design with concrete indicators.


🔗 Reference: The EcoIndex from GreenIT.fr

The EcoIndex is an evaluation method developed by the GreenIT.fr collective. It assigns a grade from A (very good) to G (very poor) to a webpage based on three factors:

  1. Page Weight (in KB)
  2. Number of HTTP Requests
  3. DOM Complexity (HTML structure)


These indicators reflect the consumption of digital resources and are translated into estimated environmental impacts (CO₂ emissions and water consumption).


💡 In Summary

This "EcoSimulateur" Figma plugin by Adveris is a simple yet powerful tool for embedding eco-design principles into the design process. It turns every mockup into a lever for environmental performance, empowering designers to act right from the earliest stages to create a more sustainable web.
plugins.tagline: Simulate the EcoIndex of your design!

plugins.name: Tidy Guide (Beta)
plugins.description:
Wasting time on manual documentation creation?


Efficient way to share your design system with your team


Tidy Guide - our new plugin that will help you build design system documentation quickly and easily - inside Figma!


Within minutes you will have comprehensive and up-to-date documentation of your design system.


Tidy Guide was born out of a deep understanding of the need for UX designers to have an efficient and easy-to-use solution for creating documentation.


Tidy Guide helps with:

  • Automatic creation of comprehensive and up-to-date documentation.
  • A trusted source of dynamic documentation
  • Eliminating the need to create every documentation manually.
  • Sharing your design system with your team and stakeholders
  • Maintaining consistency and high-quality design


Here are some examples of how to use Tidy Guide:


System Designers:

Use Tidy Guide to create up-to-date documentation of your design system. Then, share the documentation with the rest of the team.


Editors in Figma:

Use Tidy Guide to view the design system documentation and learn how to use the different components.


Product Managers:

Use Tidy Guide to better understand the design system and make informed decisions about product development.


Significant time savings, allowing you to focus on creative work.


Try Tidy and see for yourself how it can save you time and effort!


For additional information and a closer look at Tidy, check out our website: https://tidy.guide/
plugins.tagline: Internal documentation your team can finally trust

plugins.name: CreatoCode Figma to Code: ArtUI,ArtTS,iOS(Objective-C), React Native(Flexbox),HarmonyOS
plugins.description:
Currently only supports React Native, iOS, HarmonyOS ArtUI ArtTS


  1. Layout with Flexbox
  2. Supports component type conversion: can convert images, text into buttons, input fields, etc., to generate button or input field components.
  3. When exporting code, it supports directly exporting images and batch importing images into the project.
  4. Automatically recognizes images to be exported: can adjust the images to be exported based on the distance between design elements to improve accuracy; or manually export without selecting "auto recognize images".
  5. The generated code can use custom components: as the platform only extracts necessary parameters to initialize components, you can use custom components by simply modifying the initialization function implementation.
plugins.tagline: Generate code with one click.

plugins.name: Style Audit for Text Nodes (CSV Export)
plugins.description:
Have you found it difficult finding out what styles you or your designers are using? Are these from a local library or a remote library? How many text nodes are styled and how many pending?


This plugin is for you if you need a CSV export of Text Style names and Fill Style names for all text nodes within the current page.


Feel free to request features.


Plan to add the following features:


  1. Text Node details like font size, line height, etc.
  2. Simple charts to show % of library use (Local vs Remote)


This is an open source project. Feel free to contribute by forking the Figma Text Style Audit Repo.
plugins.tagline: CSV export of Text Style names and Fill Style names for all text nodes within current page

plugins.name: Ordered Fill
plugins.description:
This plugin finds all selected, filled elements (shapes, frames, groups, text layers, etc) and their nested children and applies your defined color styles in a repeating order.


Elements are filled from left to right, top to bottom using the center of the element as the axis point. Automatically skips over any elements with an image or video fill, or elements without a fill present.


Note: To manually tag elements you don't want filled, include an asterisk (*) in the layer name.


Open-sourced on Github:

https://github.com/kylielacour/Ordered-Fill

accepted.name: Kylie LaCour
accepted.description: Enthusiast of elegant digital systems, dedicated advocate of fluid responsive design, and novice creator of plugins.

plugins.tagline: Easily fills all selected elements with colors from your palette in a repeating order.

plugins.name: Layer Name Styles
plugins.description:
Layer Name Styles


You can use this plugin to apply styles written in layer names so you don't have to go back and forth between the left and right sidebar.

You can write style snippets in a simplified Emmet-like notation.


How to use


  1. write a style snippet by enclosing it with "[]" in the layer name. If there are multiple snippets, separate them with a space.　For example, "Layer name [w200 h300]".
  2. Select the layer to which you want to apply the style (if not selected, all the top layers will be applied).
  3. Press the "Apply" button.


Example of how to write layer names


Articles [lm:h sp:20 p20-40 x20]


  • Interpret the contents of "[]". You can write anything outside of "[]".
  • When writing multiple styles, separate them with a "space".
  • The order in which they are written does not matter.
  • If the target property duplicates in multiple styles, it will be overwritten by the later written style.


Setting items


Exclude child layers

Turn "ON" to include only parent layers and exclude child layers.


Include locked layers

Turn "ON" to include locked layers.


Apply at plugin activation

Turn "ON" to apply at plugin activation.


There is no setting to add shortcut keys to the Figma application, although it would be useful in combination with shortcut keys.

If you are a Mac user, you can add shortcuts in the following way.

see: Customize Figma shortcut keys


Ignore bracket

Turn "ON" to to ignore bracket.

If you turn this "ON", be careful not to duplicate layer names and style snippets.


Documentation


Properties and Values

Styles have "properties" and "values.

If you write "w200", "w" is the property for width and "200" is the value you want to set for width.


Ambiguous Writing

Style snippets do not have to be written with strict rules to be interpreted.

For example, these all mean the same thing:

"w200", "w-200", "w:200"


Style snippets (Common)


x (X-coordinate)

[x20]
//x:20


y (Y-coordinate)

[y20]
//y:20


w (Width)

[w200]
//width: 200

variations

[w200]
[width200]


h (Height)

[h300]
//height: 300

variations

[h300]
[height300]


Style snippets (Frame only)


lm (Layout Mode)

[lm:h]
//Layout Mode: "HORIZONTAL"

[lm:v]
//Layout Mode: "VERTICAL"

variations

//HORIZONTAL
[lm:h]
[col]

//VERTICAL
[lm:v]
[row]


sp (Item Spacing)

[sp40]
//Item Spacing: 40

[sp:a]
//This is a special specification.
//The spacing mode is "SPACE BETWEEN".

variations

[sp40]
[g40]


p (Padding)

[p20]
//Padding
//top & bottom & left & right: 20

[p20-40]
//Padding
//top & bottom: 20, left & right: 40

[p20-40-20]
//Padding
//top: 20, left & right: 40, bottom: 20

[p20-40-20-40]
//Padding
//top: 20, right: 40, bottom: 20, left: 40


px (Padding-Left, Padding-Right)

[px20]


py (Padding-Top, Padding-Bottom)

[py20]


pt (Padding-Top)

[pt20]


pb (Padding-Bottom)

[pb20]


pl (Padding-Left)

[pl20]


pr (Padding-Right)

[pr20]
plugins.tagline: You can apply styles written in layer names (with Emmet-like notation)

plugins.name: Export Exterminator
plugins.description:
Use this plugin to quickly remove all exports nested inside other exports.


Bulk exporting in Figma can be a real timesaver. But when your document gets to a certain size and complexity, there's likely to be unwanted exports hiding in the depths of your document.


Tracking down all the nested exports manually is a real chore, and that's where this plugin comes in handy. Export Exterminator removes all exports within another export, leaving you with only the top level ones you’ve carefully prepared.


This is how to use it:


  1. Make sure you’ve installed the plugin 😛
  2. Go to Plugins -> Export Exterminator OR search for Export Exterminator from the Quick Actions menu.
  3. Once you’ve pressed it, a notification will appear with your results, e.g. “4 exports removed”.
  4. That’s it. Run it on any page you’d like to sweep clean of nested exports.


Good to know:


  • Changes are applied to the current page.
  • There is no warning/confirmation before the Exterminator does its thing.
plugins.tagline: Get rid of exports within exports

plugins.name: EventStorming Visualizer
plugins.description:
Unlock the power of EventStorming directly within Figjam!


EventStorming Visualizer seamlessly integrates the practices of EventStorming, helping teams to collaboratively explore complex business domains. With automatic scanning of stickies, intelligent connectors, and real-time visualization, this plugin streamlines your domain-driven design process.


Quick Start Guide:

  1. Platform Selection: Ensure you're on the FigJam platform, as our plugin leverages components exclusive to FigJam.
  2. Initiating with Sticky: Manually drag a sticky onto the canvas. The plugin is optimized to detect yellow, blue, or purple stickies. For beginners, we recommend starting with a yellow sticky, representing an event, as event stickies are frequently used.
  3. Sticky Functionality: Different stickies have unique UI buttons that allow them to perform various tasks.
  4. Building Relationships: Drag and connect various stickies using connectors. Our plugin will automatically document the relationships between each sticky for you.
  5. Exporting Your Work: Once you've completed the event storming process, easily export your data through the UI when no selection is made.


Features:

  1. Auto-Scan Stickies: Automatically identifies and categorizes sticky notes based on their properties, ensuring your EventStorming sessions remain organized.
  2. Intelligent Connectors: Builds relationships between stickies with smart connector logic, enhancing clarity in your domain events, policies, and actions.
  3. Collaborative Highlighting: With multi-user support, track parent-child relationships across the canvas, ensuring synchronous understanding within your team.
  4. Real-time Updates: Ensures everyone is on the same page with synchronized state updates, promoting collaborative efficiency.
  5. Intuitive Message Bus System: Easily publish and subscribe to domain events, furthering your EventStorming expertise.


Harness the combined power of Figma and EventStorming with this essential tool. Perfect for domain-driven design enthusiasts, enterprise architects, and teams looking to drive clarity in complex projects.
plugins.tagline: A FigJam Plugin for Organizing Event Storming Workshops

plugins.name: Wantedly Preflight
plugins.description:
Wantedly Preflight is a Figma plugin that validates your project satisfies the rules of the design system of Wantedly.


Features

  •  Validation ― You can check whether the node is valid just by running the plugin. The result will come out with a detailed message and you can jump into fixing it immediately with a focus button.
  •  Configurable ― Wantedly Preflight has 6+ sophisticated rule and all of them are well-tested. However, in case if you would like to opt-out of some of the rule in your project, you can independently configure items to enable.
  •  Ignore ― Exceptions are always there. On the result page, you have a check button to ignore the specific node. After you ignored a node, it will always be considered appropriate regardless of whether it violates our rules or not.


Our Design System

See Wantedly UI Components

accepted.name: Wantedly
accepted.description: Wantedly, Inc. Design & Editorial Squad - We are shaping a world where work drives passion, through designing products and communications.
